Holy crap, this game is good.
I don't usually write detailed reviews, but here goes.

The puzzles are a lot of fun, it just feels amazing to finally figure out the obvious answer to something you've been stuck on for the past 15 minutes, plus the physics and portal mechanics are just great to play around with. The graphics and the environments are simply sublime, I cannot overstate how beautiful and hauntingly huge the maps are. The soundtrack is also incredibly fitting to the environments, and simply great music.

And the characters, oh boy the characters. This has to be one of the funniest games, hell, one of the funniest pieces of media, I've ever experienced. The characters are incredibly detailed and interact beautifully with each other, even if there's not a lot of them (quality over quantity, am I right), and I their sarcastic attitude fits in perfectly with my sense of humor. Absolutely one of the top games of all time in my opinion.

TL;DR : Beautiful, funny game, fun mechanics, play now
This game is so fun! I play it with my brother and we love it it's a good game for your mind. It's so cool how the portals work! If you have it do you like it?!

Portal 2 was the first Valve game I ever got into back in my Xbox 360 days. Sure, I had Left 4 Dead but without online capabilities that became monotonous rather quickly. I knew Valve games were held in high regard back then but I never understood why until I had one I could become invested in. That game was Portal 2!

Remember CD's? Me neither. Anyway, Portal 2. Picking up where the tech demo that is Portal essentially ended off, you wake up in the testing centre because the big boss in charge of operating the facility is still dead after you murdered her in the last game (oops, spoilers) and you have to escape the facility.
You're guided by the asphalt milkshake that is Wheatley, a petrified and humorous robot designed to assist the humans when they're not involved in testing. 
Eventually through complications and no fault of your own, the big,bad boss Glados is revived and very clearly upset that you, you know, murdered her. She puts you back into the testing program to test forever & ever and your mission remains to eventually escape. 

 Valve perfected two essential pillars that make Portal 2 so memorable and enjoyable. The 1st is the writing, performed beautifully by all the voice actors involved. Glados, Wheatley, Cave Johnson, the test chamber announcer, the turrets, all of them have such dynamic dialogue that incorporates unprecedented levels of charisma, sarcasm, subtlety, passive aggressiveness and humour that you can't help but smirk or laugh at their deliveries. 
The 2nd is the gameplay loop. Using two portals to navigate a large facility in level format. These two portals slowly start including more complex mechanics and physics as the game progresses to keep gameplay fresh and challenging. There is nothing more satisfying than finally solving a puzzle you'd be stuck on for a while. This game is filled with those moments. 

Even better is that after the main game, the co-op campaign is available to continue this puzzle mayhem, only this time it involves a friend with a total of four portals for added vastness and complexity. A great mode to play with someone and feel that euphoric feeling of solving some real head-scratching puzzles. 

I personally prefer the 2nd game to the 1st, though criticism I can understand is that towards the final acts of the game it can start to feel a little too lengthily. Still, I definitely recommend this game to anyone who loves intricate uses of the English language and some really creative puzzles that can stop you in your tracks while you try solve them trial-and-error style. 

10/10 will portal again!

The story is the best of any game I have ever played.

The puzzles eased me into the mechanics at my own pace while still providing challenges, the immersion created by atmospheric lighting and background objects rivals even VR games I've experienced, and workshop integration with the level editor means I can continue enjoying the masterfully-done platforming for the indefinite future.

I would gladly have paid an extra $25 for this game.

Я понял тебя стим, когда я писал вопрос тут, почему фашисткая группа которая собирает на вашей территории деньги на войну не забанена, вы в тихую мою тему убрали на форуме что ж недавно мне пришел ответ от поддержки, мол спасибо мы приняли меры, я решил проверить какие меры вы там приняли, группа стоит как стояла даже измененй нет.
Я тебя понял стим, раз вы считаете это нормальным и ваши же правила это только для "русни" на бумаге верно? Тогда мне с вами не по пути, пофиг на бабки уровни прочее что я потратил, если вы такие лицемеры, тогда без проблем, можете теперь меня банить мутить чё вы там умеете, я всем буду рассказывать эту историю, ведь я писал вам лично и надеюсь, когда у нас будет железный купол, что фашики очень хорошие деньги приносят и очень приятные люди, потому что меня как игрока который много во что играл и много в чём участвовал вы, этим одним поступком уничтожили, помните что стим такой же лицемер как cd project просто они делают это в тихую и скорее всего (я предполагаю) отключат самым последним, так что Русские помните, что стим не чуть не лучше тех, кто сейчас блочит игры и тд. именно нам!
Ссылка на группу, посмотрите кайфанете, все условия стим соблюдены кста, такой ответ мне пришел, https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ukraine

This Is probably my favorite game of all time. It provides a thought inducing story while also keeping you on your feet with clever puzzles that fit perfectly within the lore and environment. Even though there arn't many, the characters are quite interesting, and the story keeps you interested in them and their lore through out and after the entire game. Overall, an amazing game, and I hope to see more like it in Valve's future. (Crossing my fingers that we don't have to weight another decade)
